title: Strikes on Wednesday 1 February will disrupt daily life - No 10
description: Teachers, university workers, civil servants, train and bus drivers are all striking on 1 February.

title: Hillsborough disaster: Families profoundly failed, say police
description: Police forces promise "cultural change" as they respond to a critical report into the 1989 disaster.

title: Nicola Bulley: Police appeal for key witness in search for dog walker
description: The man, aged about 70, was seen in the River Wyre area around the time Nicola Bulley disappeared.

title: Just Stop Oil protestors convicted of attacking King waxwork
description: Eilidh McFadden and Tom Johnson slapped vegan cakes topped with shaving foam into the model's face.

title: French protests intensify against pension age rise to 64
description: Waves of protests take place across France against plans to lift the retirement age from 62 to 64.

title: Man admits killing mother and daughter and burying bodies under floor
description: Andrew Innes denies murdering Bennylyn and Jellica Burke, claiming he had diminished responsibility.

title: Family of Brighton trans woman Alice Litman say her death was due to care delay
description: Alice Litman had waited nearly three years to discuss transitioning when she took her own life.

title: Black Boy Lane poster installed behind new La Rose Lane sign
description: The poster was put up days after a north London road was renamed following concerns about racial connotations.

title: Passenger tied to seat after 'punching and spitting' at crew
description: The Italian woman, who was arrested on a complaint by crew, has denied the allegations against her.

title: Tiny gold Lord's Prayer engraved in eye of needle by Birmingham artist
description: Artist Graham Short says he has produced the work he would most like to be remembered for.

title: Over-50s at work: 'You feel your usefulness has passed'
description: A survey suggests applicants are right when they say employers are less open to hiring older workers.

title: Cost of living with food allergies becoming 'unbearable'
description: Prices of supermarket staples are rising at the fastest rate in decades, hitting "free from" shoppers hard.

title: Cost of living: Cash bonuses behind record number of bank switches
description: Up to £200 was offered by some banks to switching customers - prompting the most moves since 2013.

title: Can batch cooking help cut your shopping bills?
description: Suzanne Mulholland's time saving tips have gathered her a significant following on social media.

title: Shower at home vs at the gym: What’s cheaper?

title: Cost of living: Five tips when asking for a pay rise

title: Cost of living: Woman puts cat down jumper to keep warm
description: Sharon Hearn says she can only afford to heat her home for two hours a day.

title: NHS pressures: Staff leave social care for more money
description: One worker found social care "very rewarding" and would return if he could get truck driver wages.

title: UK inflation rate calculator: How much are prices rising for you?

title: Can I get a Cold Weather Payment and how much are they?

title: Why inflation is falling but prices are still rising
description: We report this percentage every month but here are three things you may not know.

title: Energy bills rise for 2.5 million homes on Economy 7
description: Customers on Economy 7 tariffs see bills rise 7.6% despite the government fixing prices until April.

title: Energy saving scheme: What is the energy saving scheme for electricity?
description: A scheme to reward people for cutting back on electricity use is running for a second day.

title: Sam Smith: What's behind I'm Not Here to Make Friends backlash?
description: Some say I'm Not Here to Make Friends is oversexualised but fans have called out double standards.

title: Another whale mysteriously washes ashore on US East Coast

title: Eurovision: Why is the UK hosting it and when is it on?

title: Preet Chandi: Woman sets second world record in polar expedition

title: Teacher strikes: 'Deciding to close our school has been horrible'
description: Wales High School in Rotherham will be closing to most pupils when teachers strike over pay on Wednesday.

title: Mykhailo Mudryk: Chelsea midfielder sorry for using racial slur in TikTok video
description: Chelsea forward Mykhailo Mudryk is "deeply sorry for any offence caused" after using a racial slur while reciting a rap song in a TikTok video.

title: Alessia Russo: Man Utd reject second world-record bid from Arsenal

title: Dane van Niekerk: South Africa all-rounder out of Women's T20 World Cup squad over fitness issues
